text: Half-jokingly, I said, “Don’t tell me you two plan to share a room?”
The moment the words left my mouth, the air fell silent for half a second.
“Would that be bad?” Lucia blinked at me, genuinely puzzled.
Alicia frowned slightly. Her tone was calm, but carried a chill that left no room for argument: “We’ll each take our own room.”
I froze for a moment, realizing my joke had crossed a line. I forced a laugh to cover it up. “Ah—just kidding.”
She didn’t respond. She only gave a faint nod. “Then please prepare another room for Lucia.”
Sensing the shift in the air, Lucia tugged gently at her master’s cloak. “Let’s go upstairs, Master.”
Alicia turned and walked away. Her silhouette stretched long in the firelight at the foot of the stairs.
I sighed and looked down at the open ledger on the counter. Somehow, the room felt quieter than before.
